Topic.Title: Anyone have TDAmeritrade?

Message.Msg: Thanks for that PJ. I agree with tech and PJ here 100% that that 2017 sales number is virtually impossible - an increase of 120B!). One thing to add - when an analyst does that analysis, he/she has to assume an expected return for shareholders until the terminal year (2017 in this case). If he applied a 25 P/E to that 2017 EPS, he gets a target 2017 price of $278.50 (25 x $11.14). If you assume a P/E of 25 in 2017, you should expect a shareholder return of 25% each year until then. If you back out 25% a year for 5 years, you get a 2012 target price of $91.26. That is what AMZN stock should be today if you expect $120B in incremental sales over the next 5 years and a return on that. Amazingly today, shareholders only expect a 4% annual return to get to $278.50 in 2017 from today's price to take on the risk of AMZN tripling sales over the next 5 years (while tripling their net margin at the same time)! Another view of an amazing imablance. You are better of buying treasuries!

Message.Msg: 6000_baby: You really haven't answered my question. Just to be clear, i believe we are at the start of a 2 year bear market. On the DOW it started Sept 2012 and will last until Sept 2014. Numerous reasons, but the main reason was the close election was stimulating the economy. Now that the election is over, the only stimulus that I can see is lower gas prices. When Obamacare kicks in in 2013 (which I am for), Sick people will have to pay a higher deductible and people without health insurance will have to pay higher taxes. This is disruptive. Same thing happened in 1935 when Social Security taxes kicked in, and they were only 1% back then.

Message.Title: Thanks Sybs...
Message.Msg: I do appreciate perspective from you. My biggest positions remain undisclosed because I am testing whether my silent positions outperform the ones I post on these message boards. Right now, that seems to be the case. If that remains the case through end of month, you won't have to worry about verbose posts from me because I will cease to post at all on the message boards (not going to stop investing by any means -- things are playing out largely as I expected). I've learned from your trades / read of the technicals (and H/T tip Cash as well). But, at this point, I see little value in providing perspective for folks like NAS, GeeGee and Nem. I suspect that will leave you the target of the bashing... I'll always be happy to correspond via my Yahoo Mail account with those of you who have been decent and are genuinely trying to do the right thing (e.g. PJ)... Lastly, you are right that options will crush most people. I've had to learn the hard way. Taken some wild rides. For the record, what NAS was really trying to obscure was the fact that I called the trade that the option scalping algo trade had been playing -- beating Apple and Google down and holding AMZN up over the past few weeks. That's why AAPL and GOOG were up WAY more than AMZN today and will continue to show strength well beyond Amazon. I now understand the way the game is played pretty well and have learned to do with options what you do with the underlying... Buy after others get squeezed out and capitulate. But, the time element of it makes it much easier to screw up. Oh, by the way, Tiger apparently took at 9.9% stake in GRPN. Looks like one of the best seems to be seeing the same thing as I do. In the green and sitting on 100 Jan $2 call contracts. Have a good one.
